name: Beautiful Bash: Let's make reading and writing bash scripts fun again!
Best Practices for Writing Bash Scripts
Cinnamon
description: Strives to provide a traditional user experience.

name: EDE
description: Small desktop environment built to be responsive, light in resource usage and to have a familiar look and feel.

name: LXQt
description: Qt port and the upcoming version of LXDE, the Lightweight Desktop Environment. It is the product of the merge between the LXDE-Qt and the Razor-qt projects: A lightweight, modular, blazing-fast and user-friendly desktop environment.

name: MATE
description: Provides an intuitive and attractive desktop to Linux users using traditional metaphors. Fork of GNOME 2.

name: Pantheon
description: Pantheon is the default desktop environment originally created for the elementary OS distribution. The desktop has some similarities with GNOME Shell and macOS.

name: 9wm
description: Window manager that attempts to emulate the Plan 9 window manager 8-1/2 as far as possible within the constraints imposed by X.

name: awesome
description: Highly configurable window manager for X. Fast and extensible.

name: Blackbox
description: Lightweight window manager for the X window system, without library dependencies. Built using C++.

name: bspwm
description: Tiling window manager that represents windows as the leaves of a full binary tree.

name: Compiz
description: OpenGL compositing window manager. It has a plug-in system to be changed at runtime.

name: dwm
description: Dynamic window manager for X. It manages windows in tiled, monocle and floating layouts. All of the layouts can be applied dynamically, optimising the environment for the application and task performed.

name: Enlightenment
description: Window manager bundled with a whole suite of libraries to help you create beautiful user interfaces.

name: Fluxbox
description: Window manager for X, lightweight and easy to handle but full of features to make an easy and fast desktop experience. Built using C++.

name: FVWM
description: ICCCM-compliant multiple virtual desktop window manager for X. Extremely powerful.

name: i3
description: Tiling window manager. BSD-licensed. Primarily targeted at advanced users and developers.

name: IceWM
description: Window manager with the goal of being fast, simple, and not getting in the user's way.

name: JWM
description: Lightweight window manager for X11. Good choice for older and/or less powerful systems, though perfectly capable of running on modern systems. Built using C.

name: Matchbox
description: Environment for X running on non-desktop embedded platforms such as handhelds, set-top boxes, kiosks and anything else for which screen space, input mechanisms or system resources are limited.

name: Mutter
description: Window manager for X. Default window manager in GNOME 3.

name: Openbox
description: Highly configurable window manager with extensive standards support.

name: ratpoison
description: A simple window manager with no library dependencies, no graphics, and no decorations. Modeled after GNU Screen.

name: Sawfish
description: Extensible window manager. Its aim is to manage windows in the most flexible and attractive manner possible. Built using Lisp-based scripting language.

name: wmii
description: Small, scriptable window manager, with a 9P filesystem interface and an acme-like layout.

name: xmonad
description: Dynamically tiling X11 window manager. Makes work easier by automating aligning and searching for windows. Built using Haskell.

name: Builder
description: IDE for GNOME that is focused on bringing the power of the GNOME platform to more developers.

name: Evince
description: The most popular document viewer on the GNOME platform.

name: Gedit
description: Powerful general purpose text editor.

name: Polari
description: IRC client built to be easy to use.

name: To Do
description: Minimalistic personal task manager designed to fit right into your GNOME desktop.

name: FeedReader
description: RSS desktop client able to integrate with multiple online services.

name: Go For It!
description: To-do list with built-in productivity timer.

name: NaSC
description: Intelligent calculator app.

name: Spice-Up
description: Desktop presentation app.

name: Vocal
description: Podcast client for the modern desktop.

name: Dolphin
description: File manager for KDE focusing on usability.

name: Krita
description: Painting program.

name: Atom
description: Hackable text editor for the 21st century.

name: ghostwriter
description: Distraction-free Markdown editor.

name: GParted
description: The most popular disk partitioning software out there.

name: Kodi
description: Most popular entertainment center.

name: Zathura
description: Highly customizable document viewer. It provides a minimalistic and space saving interface as well as an easy usage that mainly focuses on keyboard interaction.

name: Etcher
description: Flash OS images to SD cards and USB drives, safely and easily.

name: Corebird
description: Twitter client.

name: GNOME Twitch
description: Twitch player.

name: Caprine
description: Facebook's Messenger client with some added privacy features.

name: PB for Desktop
description: Pushbullet client.

name: ramme
description: Instagram client.

name: Whatever
description: Evernote client based on the web version.

name: Y PPA Manager (Ubuntu)
description: Manage PPAs and search for packages.

name: pirut (Fedora)
description: Provides a set of graphical tools for managing software.

name: Synaptics (Debian and .deb users)
description: Graphical package management program for apt.

name: YaST (openSUSE)
description: Main package management tool on openSUSE.

name: dnfdragora (Fedora)
description: A GUI for the dnf package manager.

name: Yay (Arch)
description: Yay is one of the many wrappers to pacman which automatically downloads and installs packages from AUR, a full list can be found here.

name: Aura (Arch)
description: Secure, multilingual package manager.

name: AppImageKit
description: Using AppImageKit you can package applications in the AppImage format that runs on common Linux-based operating systems, such as RHEL, CentOS, Ubuntu, Fedora, debian and derivatives; one app = one file.

name: cmus
description: Small, fast and powerful console music player.

name: fuck
description: Command line tool which corrects your previously mistyped command.

name: git
description: Distributed version control system designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with speed and efficiency.

name: glances
description: Cross-platform system monitoring tool.

name: htop
description: Nice looking, customizable task manager.

name: nano
description: Simple to use text editor.

name: photorec
description: Useful tool for restoring deleted files.

name: ranger
description: Vim-inspired file manager for the console.

name: screenFetch
description: Fetches system/theme information in terminal.

name: shellcheck
description: Static analysis tool for shell scripts.

name: speed-test
description: Test your Internet connection speed and ping using speedtest.net.

name: testdisk
description: A tool for disk partition recovery.

name: tig
description: Text-mode interface for git. It functions mainly as a Git repository browser.

name: vim
description: Advanced text editor that seeks to provide the power of the de-facto Unix editor 'Vi', with a more complete feature set.

name: vtop
description: Easily-extendable activity monitor.

name: wavemon
description: Monitoring application for wireless network devices.

name: youtube-dl
description: A tool to download videos from YouTube and other video sites.
